petri.api
Class NetworkAdapter

java.lang.Object
  petri.api.NetworkAdapter

public class NetworkAdapter
extends java.lang.Object

Provides convience methods for connecting to a specified IP address and port, or hosting on the IP on a given port. Provides access to input and output stream for receiving and sending data over the network. A ConnectionListener is created to determine if any data is available on the input stream. This is to prevent a system resource lag in attempting to constantly read from the stream.

Author:
Cody Swendrowski

Method Detail

dataAvailable

public void dataAvailable()
Called from ConnectionListener. Signals that there is data available on the input stream.

connect

public void connect(java.lang.String IPAddress,
                    int port)
             throws java.io.IOException
Connects to a given IP Address and port over the network.

Parameters:
IPAddress - The IP Address to connect to
port - The port on the IP Address to connect to
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the connection fails. Usually signifies an incorrect IPAddress and port configuration.

host

public void host(int port)
          throws java.io.IOException
Hosts a connection on the given port. To be able to properly connect outside of the LAN, the end-user much port forward this port to be able to communicate. Hamachi is a third-party program that can bypass this restriction, allowing another end-user to connect to the host without port-forwarding.

Parameters:
port - The port to host on
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the connection fails. Usually signifies a taken-port or lack of host rights.

isDataAvailable

public boolean isDataAvailable()
Returns true if there is data available in the input stream. Used to prevent constant attempts to read an empty input stream.

Returns:
true if data is available in the input stream.

clearDataAvailable

public void clearDataAvailable()
Called after user handles all data available in the input stream. Sets dataAvailable to false until new data retriggers it to true.

getInputStream

public java.io.DataInputStream getInputStream()
Returns the InputStream. Used to read data sent over the network.

Returns:
input

getOutputStream

public java.io.DataOutputStream getOutputStream()
Returns the OutputStream. Used to send data over the network.

Returns:
output
